Questions.Question: Who said 'The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.'?
Questions.Explanation: Nelson Mandela, the South African anti-apartheid revolutionary, said this inspiring quote.

Questions.Question: Who said 'The only way to do great work is to love what you do.'?
Questions.Explanation: Steve Jobs, the co-founder of Apple Inc., famously said this quote about passion and success.

Questions.Question: Who said 'The best way to predict the future is to create it.'?
Questions.Explanation: Peter Drucker, a renowned management consultant, is credited with this quote about shaping the future.

Questions.Question: Who said 'Leadership is not about being in charge. It is about taking care of those in your charge.'?
Questions.Explanation: Simon Sinek, a motivational speaker and author, emphasized the importance of servant leadership.

Questions.Question: Who said 'The function of leadership is to produce more leaders, not more followers.'?
Questions.Explanation: Ralph Nader, an American political activist, highlighted the role of leadership in empowering others.

Questions.Question: Who said 'A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way.'?
Questions.Explanation: John C. Maxwell, an author and speaker, defined leadership as guiding others towards a common goal.

Questions.Question: Who said 'Leadership is the capacity to translate vision into reality.'?
Questions.Explanation: Warren Bennis, a pioneer in leadership studies, emphasized the importance of turning vision into action.

Questions.Question: Who said 'The greatest leader is not necessarily the one who does the greatest things. He is the one that gets the people to do the greatest things.'?
Questions.Explanation: Ronald Reagan, the 40th President of the United States, highlighted the power of inspiring others.
